title: 105_hr1488
content: The "International Financial Institution Reform and Authorization Act of 1997" authorizes the United States to contribute $1.6 billion to the International Development Association for its eleventh replenishment. This contribution is subject to necessary appropriations and there are no fiscal year limitations on the appropriation. The Asian Development Bank Act is amended to authorize a $400,000,000 contribution to the Asian Development Fund, subject to appropriations. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to appropriate the funds. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development Act is amended to authorize the United States participation in a general capital increase of the Bank, allowing for an increase in the United States capital subscription by 100,000 additional shares. This is subject to obtaining the necessary appropriations. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development Act is amended to authorize an increase in the United States capital subscription by 100,000 additional shares, with $1,270,100,000 authorized to be appropriated without fiscal year limitation for payment by the Secretary of the Treasury. SEC. 5. INTER-AMERICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK. The Inter-American Development Bank Act is amended to authorize appropriations for the United States capital subscription for the eighth general increase in the authorized capital stock of the Bank. SEC. 6. INTEREST SUBSIDY ACCOUNT OF THE SUCCESSOR TO THE ENHANCED STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT FACILITY OF THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND. The Bretton Woods Agreements Act is amended to establish an interest subsidy account for the successor to the Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility of the International Monetary Fund. The United States Governor of the Fund may contribute $75,000,000 to the Interest Subsidy Account of the successor to the Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility of the Fund, subject to appropriations Acts. To fund this contribution, not to exceed $75,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated without fiscal year limitation. SEC. 7 of the Bretton Woods Agreements Act is amended to increase the borrowing limit from the International Monetary Fund to $6,712,000,000.
